Get the valid values for a facet (that you can use in bcdc_search())

Source: R/bcdc_search.R
bcdc_search_facets.Rd

Get the valid values for a facet (that you can use in bcdc_search())

bcdc_search_facets(
  facet = c("license_id", "download_audience", "res_format", "sector", "organization",
    "groups")
)

Arguments

facet

the facet(s) for which to retrieve valid values. Can be one or more of: "license_id", "download_audience", "res_format", "sector", "organization", "groups"

Value

A data frame of values for the selected facet

Examples

# \donttest{
try(
  bcdc_search_facets("res_format")
)
#>         facet count display_name         name
#> 1  res_format    28          zip          zip
#> 2  res_format    21          xml          xml
#> 3  res_format   598         xlsx         xlsx
#> 4  res_format   308          xls          xls
#> 5  res_format   845          wms          wms
#> 6  res_format    27          txt          txt
#> 7  res_format   847          shp          shp
#> 8  res_format   130          pdf          pdf
#> 9  res_format    69        other        other
#> 10 res_format    11 openapi-json openapi-json
#> 11 res_format  1112     multiple     multiple
#> 12 res_format    22          kmz          kmz
#> 13 res_format   851          kml          kml
#> 14 res_format    12         json         json
#> 15 res_format    82         html         html
#> 16 res_format    17      geojson      geojson
#> 17 res_format   840         fgdb         fgdb
#> 18 res_format   798          e00          e00
#> 19 res_format   503          csv          csv
#> 20 res_format    92  arcgis_rest  arcgis_rest
# }
